newsitem.title: SWEDEN: ATLAS COPCO SEES UPTURN FOR CMT '97, '98.
newsitem.headline: ATLAS COPCO SEES UPTURN FOR CMT '97, '98.

text.p: Swedish engineering firm Atlas Copco said on Wednesday that its weakest business area Construction and Mining Technique (CMT) could improve this year or in 1998.
"This year or next year I think we could see a turnaround in trends," chief executive Giulio Mazzalupi told a news conference in connection with the group releasing six-month earnings.
"Whether this means a profit margin of 10.2 percent or 9.8 percent is not essential."
Atlas Copco has a target of a double digit profit margins.
"The potential is there and CMT can generate double-digit margins," he said. "CMT is the result of many small acquisitions and needs constant consolidation and structural overhaul."
Atlas Copco said profit after financial items rose 10 percent to 1.72 billion crowns in the first half of the year compared to a year ago, well ahead of market expectations of 1.55 billion.
